description: The dwarf serviceberry (Amelanchier alnifolia var. pumila) is an amazing shrub due to its short stature and ease of maintenance. These deciduous shrubs form mounding clumps that only reach 3 feet in height making them a great choice for smaller gardens and landscapes. In spring, white flowers cover the plant in a haze of beauty while in fall, vibrant orange and red foliage add a splash of seasonal color. In summer, small berries are harvested by wildlife and birds, but can also be eaten by humans. This shrub is a great choice for those looking for low-maintenance and incredible beauty in a small package.
